alert.note: Alert for Bladen (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 06 at 8:21AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast North Carolina, including the following county, Bladen. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 AM EDT, Radar indicates heavy rain due to showers is finally ending. Minor flooding should continue in the advisory area. Radar and automated rain gauges show between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen just north of White Lake. - Rapid rises could occur downstream along Colly Creek as far south as the community of Lagoon. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... White Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
